Plot Skew-T, hodograph and convective indices on a single layout

Source: R/sounding_plot.R
sounding_plot.Rd

Function to plot a composite of Skew-T, hodograph and other relavant rawindsonde-derived profiles \ on a single layout

sounding_plot(
  pressure,
  altitude,
  temp,
  dpt,
  wd,
  ws,
  convert = FALSE,
  ptop = 100,
  interpolate = TRUE,
  title = "",
  parcel = "MU",
  max_speed = 25,
  hazards = FALSE,
  ...
)

Arguments

pressure

- air pressure (hPa)
altitude

- in metres
temp

- air temperature (degree Celsius)
dpt

- dew point temperature (degree Celsius)
wd

- wind direction in degrees (0-360)
ws

- wind speed in m/s
convert

logical. Whether to convert wind speed from knots to m/s (default FALSE)
ptop

Pressure top level to be used for plotting wind speed. Valid options should be < 200 hPa (100 by default)
interpolate

logical, draw wind barbs only at interpolated altitudes with 1 km interval (default = TRUE) instead of all wind barbs for a given input dataset
title

title to be added in the layout's header
parcel

tracing for "MU", "ML" or "SB" parcel
max_speed

max speed for defining hodograph limits
hazards

logical. Whether to add extra information about possibility of severe weather risk
...

extra graphic arguments

Examples

data("sounding_wien")
sounding_wien = na.omit(sounding_wien)
attach(sounding_wien)

#> The following objects are masked from sounding_wien (pos = 3):
#> 
#>     DRCT, DWPT, HGHT, MIXR, PRES, RELH, SKNT, TEMP, THTA, THTE, THTV
#> The following objects are masked from sounding_wien (pos = 4):
#> 
#>     DRCT, DWPT, HGHT, MIXR, PRES, RELH, SKNT, TEMP, THTA, THTE, THTV
#> The following objects are masked from sounding_wien (pos = 5):
#> 
#>     DRCT, DWPT, HGHT, MIXR, PRES, RELH, SKNT, TEMP, THTA, THTE, THTV
#> The following objects are masked from sounding_wien (pos = 6):
#> 
#>     DRCT, DWPT, HGHT, MIXR, PRES, RELH, SKNT, TEMP, THTA, THTE, THTV
#> The following objects are masked from sounding_wien (pos = 7):
#> 
#>     DRCT, DWPT, HGHT, MIXR, PRES, RELH, SKNT, TEMP, THTA, THTE, THTV
sounding_plot(PRES, HGHT, TEMP, DWPT, DRCT, SKNT, 
              parcel = "MU", title = "Wien - 2011/08/23, 12:00 UTC")

#> Your display device is 6.66666666666667 x 6.66666666666667 in. 
#> It is recommended to use at least 10 x 7.5 in. plotting window 
#> or consider saving the layout into file
